availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Caroline E. Morgan. Father of Lydia A. Morgan, Robert C. Morgan, and Mary E. Morgan. Farmer in Adair County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 50. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Columbia, Division 2, p. 5. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Columbia, Division 2, p. 1. Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 8, p. 4.
